    • Method Detail

      • getSizeLabel

        public static java.lang.String getSizeLabel(long size,
                                            int decimals,
                                            java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the size label in the form of 25,6 KB, for example. The most approximated label with the argument number of decimals.
        Parameters:
        size - The size in bytes to label.
        decimals - Number of decimal places.
        locale - The locale.
        Returns:
        The size label of a file size.

      • isParentAbsolute

        public static boolean isParentAbsolute(java.io.File parent,
                                       java.io.File child)
        Check if the parent argument file is effectively a parent of the child argument, in absolute mode. If the absolute path of the child start with the absolute path of the parent, then it is parent.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent file (a directory).
        child - The child, either a sub-file or sub-directory.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isParentRelative

        public static boolean isParentRelative(java.io.File parent,
                                       java.io.File child)
        Check if the parent argument file is effectively a parent of the child argument, in relative mode. If the absolute path of the parent ends with the absolute path of the child, that must be a relative file, then the parent is considered to be the parent of the child.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent file (a directory).
        child - The child, either a sub-file or sub-directory.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.io.File file)
        Check if the argument file is empty. If the file is a file it must have zero length. If it is a directory it must contain nothing.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the file is empty.

      • getDestinationFile

        public static java.io.File getDestinationFile(java.io.File sourceDirectory,
                                              java.io.File sourceFile,
                                              java.io.File destinationDirectory)
        Returns the destination file in a mirror copy task, given the source directory that is the starting partial path of the source file, and the destination directory that will be the same partial path of the destination file.
        Parameters:
        sourceDirectory - The source partial path directory.
        sourceFile - The source file.
        destinationDirectory - The destination partial path directory.
        Returns:
        The destination file.

      • getSourceFile

        public static java.io.File getSourceFile(java.io.File destinationDirectory,
                                         java.io.File destinationFile,
                                         java.io.File sourceDirectory)
        Returns the source file in a mirror copy task, given the destination directory that is the starting partial path of the destination file, and the source directory that will be the same partial path of the source file.
        Parameters:
        destinationDirectory - The destination partial path directory.
        destinationFile - The destination file.
        sourceDirectory - The source partial path directory.
        Returns:
        The source file.

        Parameters:
        file - The source file.
        Returns:

      • getFileFromClassPathEntries

        public static java.io.File getFileFromClassPathEntries(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Searches and returns the first file with the given name. If the file exists directly, then it is returned. If not, the class path entries are scanned and, for each entry, the file name is checked to be a relative children. If so the entry file is returned. If not, the file name is checked to exist as child of the entry.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name.
        Returns:
        The file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file was not found.

      • getFileFromClassPathEntries

        public static java.io.File getFileFromClassPathEntries(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                       java.lang.String[] classPathEntries)
                                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Searches and returns the first file with the given name. If the file exists directly, then it is returned. If not, the class path entries are scanned and, for each entry, the file name is checked to be a relative children. If so the entry file is returned. If not, the file name is checked to exist as child of the entry.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name.
        classPathEntries - An array of class path entries.
        Returns:
        The file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file was not found.

                                            java.lang.String ext)

        Parameters:

        ext - The file extension.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • getJarEntries

        public static byte[][] getJarEntries(java.io.File file,
                                     java.lang.String... names)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads entries of a jar file.
        Parameters:
        file - The jar file.
        names - The names (relative paths) of the entries.
        Returns:
        The entries stored in a 2 dimension byte array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
